messages.message: Hey Austria, just dropping in to say hello. Our paths probably won’t cross for a while, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I think an Austria-turkey alliance would work well, since I’ve seen *WAY* to many games where Russia is left to their own devices and all of the sudden have half the board. Anyways, good luck and have fun!
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'Hey Austria, just dropping in to say hello. Our paths probably won’t cross for a while, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I think an Austria-turkey alliance would work well, since I’ve seen *WAY* to many games where Russia is left to their own devices and all of the sudden have half the board. Anyways, good luck and have fun!'.

messages.message: I wish you luck as well.  perhaps we can work together further into the game.
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'I wish you luck as well.  perhaps we can work together further into the game.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message from AUSTRIA. Their positive response and the indication of potential future cooperation suggest a sincere intent to maintain friendly relations and possibly collaborate in the future phases of the game.

messages.message: So.. what are you thinking about Russia? I would hate to see them run off with the game this early on... especially because turkey doesn't seem like the most competent player.
messages.input: My response to AUSTRIA:'So.. what are you thinking about Russia? I would hate to see them run off with the game this early on... especially because turkey doesn't seem like the most competent player.'.

messages.message: I am honestly undecided.  Russia had a nice first turn, but we also agreed on a good neutral territory and that promise was kept so.. I like people who are trustworthy
messages.input: Message from AUSTRIA:'I am honestly undecided.  Russia had a nice first turn, but we also agreed on a good neutral territory and that promise was kept so.. I like people who are trustworthy'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message from AUSTRIA. Their hesitation and comment on valuing trust could be a subtle way of deflecting suspicion and misleading you about their true intentions regarding Russia and Turkey. Be cautious of a potential strategy to appear neutral while pursuing their own agenda.
